intro: Tragia angolensis, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments. Tragia angolensis is also known for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
